Replies.Reply: Thebes. City of the Living. Crown jewel of Pharaoh Seti the First.
Home of Imhotep, High Priest of Osiris, Keeper of the Dead.
Birthplace of Anck-su-namun. Pharaoh's Mistress. No other man was allowed to touch her.
But for our love, we were willing to risk life itself.
What are you doing here?
WHO HAS TOUCHED YOU?!
Imhotep?... My priest.
Pharaoh's bodyguards!
You must go. Save yourself. Only you can resurrect me.
My body is no longer his temple!
Her body was mummified, her vital organs removed and placed in sacred canopic jars.
The Book of The Living contained sacred incantations that would send the evil dead on a journey into the dark underworld.
The slaves were killed...
...and the soldiers who killed them were also slain, so that no unholy person should ever know the exact location of the burial site.
But there was another book, The Book Of The Dead, which was never to be opened, never to be read, for it contained the incantations that could bring a dead body back to life a most unholy thing.
It was hidden at Hamunaptra, City of the Dead, inside the statue of Anubis, so that no such sacrilege might ever disgrace Egypt.
But for my love of Anck-su-namun I was willing to defy the gods.
Anck-su-namun's vital organs were still fresh, so a human sacrifice would not need be made.
Anck-su-namun soul had come back from the dead! Now all that was needed, was to return her organs to their rightful place within her body.
My Priests were condemned to be mummified alive.
As for me, I was condemned to endure the HOM-DAI. The worst of all ancient curses. One so horrible, it had never before been bestowed.
By eating the sacred scarabs, I would be cursed to stay alive forever. And by eating me, they were cursed just the same.
I was to remain sealed inside my sarcophagus, the undead for all of eternity.

They would never allow me to be released. For I would arise a walking disease, a plague upon mankind, an unholy flesh-eater, with the strength of ages, power over the sands, and the glory of invincibility.
And if I could raise my beloved Anck-
Anck-su-namun?
Kadeesh pharos Anck-su-namun!
ANCK-SU-NAMUUUUUN!!!!
The language of the slaves.
I may have use for you. And the rewards will be great.
Where are the other sacred jars?
ANCK-SU-NAMUUUUUN!!!!
You saved me from the undead. For this, I shall make you immortal.
Koontash dai na.
Keetah mi pharos, aja nilo, isirlan.
Pared oos.
Kill them! Kill them all! And bring me the Book Of The Living!
With your death, my love and I will be invincible!
Personally, I would like to surrender. Why can we not just surrender?
Then let's run away. Right now. While we can still make it.
Then let's play dead, huh? Nobody ever does that anymore.
In the desert? What for?
I got caught robbing a synagogue. Lots of good stuff in them holy places; churches, temples, mosques, and who's guarding them?
Exactly! I speak seven languages, including Hebrew, so my specialty was synagogues. How about you? Kill somebody?
What then? Robbery? Extortion? Kidnapping!
Then what the hell are you doing here!?
It is three days down the Nile, then two days by camel, sahibs.
Along with the scorched bones of my entire garrison, sahib.
A thousand pardons, my good sahibs but there is much work to be done.
My very good friend! What a surprise.
You never were any good with the ladies, O'Connell.
Unfortunately no, these Americans are smart, they pay me only half now, half when I get them back to Cairo, so I must go all the way.
You never believed in Hamunaptra, O'Connell. Why are you going back? The devil himself lives out there.
You always did have more balls than brains.
Even?
O'Connell! I am going to kill you for this!
Hey O'Connell! Looks to me like I got all the horses!
Good morning, my friend!
Patience, my good sahib, patience.
Fools.
They belong to the dead. They will wait years for their masters to return before leaving.
Ten to one, O'Connell, your odds are no-so-good.
Just looking for you, O'Connell! I wanted to be with my friend!
Why do you like to fight so much?
The curse,... beware the curse!
Like what that Moses guy did to that Pharaoh guy?
May the good Lord protect and watch over me as a shepherd watches over his flock. And may Satan in all his forms be vanquished forever.
You left me! You left me in the desert to rot.
This is Prince Imhotep, High Priest of Osiris.
The Prince does not like to be touched by other humans. A Silly eastern superstition, I'm afraid.
He has come to help Mister Burns. Somehow I feel responsible.
Do you know where I can steal some?
Mister Burns, Prince Imhotep thanks you for your spectacles, -- and for your eyes,... and for your tongue.
But I am afraid more is needed, the Prince says he must finish the job, consummate the curse which you and your friends have brought down upon yourselves.
What friend? You're my only friend.
It is better to be the right hand of the Devil,... than in his path. As long as I serve him, I am immune.
You shall see.
The book! The black book they found at Hamunaptra! Imhotep wants it back. Said to me it would be worth it's weight in diamonds.
Something about bringing his dead girly-friend back to life. He needs the book...
And your sister.
Imhotep! IMHOTEP!
Take his hand and he will spare the others.
Come with me my princess. It is time to make you mine, forever.
Kill them.
All I remember is him turning into a blast of sand,... and then I remember nothing.
Keep moving.
Yeah?
Prince Imhotep wants your heart.
He wants your heart and your brain, your liver, your kidneys...
...and how do you say? Those slimy things, in your stomach?
Yeah! Them.
O'CONNELL!!
Go away.
Tuthmosis?... Now how did you get up here?
OHEIUGM!! AHHHHHH!
Oops.
I'm sorry, it was an accident.

You put up with me, because I can read and write ancient Egyptian, decipher hieroglyphs and hieratic, and I'm the only person within a thousand miles who knows how to properly code and catalogue this library.
Hello?
Abdul? Mohammed? Bob?
You...! YOU...!
Have you no respect for the dead?
Well I wish you'd do it sooner rather than later, before you ruin my career the way you've ruined yours.
High note? Ha! For five years you've been scrounging around Egypt, and what have you to show for it? Nothing.
Oh no, not another worthless trinket, Jonathan, if I bring one more piece of junk to the Curator to try and sell for you.
Where did you get this?
Jonathan?
I think you found something.
See the cartouche there, it's the official royal seal of Seti the First, I'm sure of it.
He was the last Pharaoh of the Old Kingdom, said to be the wealthiest Pharaoh of them all.
I've already dated it, this map is almost four thousand years old. And the hieratics over here...
It's Hamunaptra.
Yes. The City of The Dead. Where the early Pharaohs were said to have hidden the wealth of Egypt.
All we know is that the city mysteriously vanished around 2,134 B.C.
You told me you found it on a dig down in Thebes!
You lied to me!
I'm your sister.
You stole it from a drunk at the local Casbah?!
And what is he in prison for?
And what did he say?
But he's just a filthy criminal?
Broad?!
We uh,... found... your puzzle box, and we've come to ask you about it.
No?
How do you know the box pertains to Hamunaptra?
You were actually at Hamunaptra?
Yes, well...
I know my brother.
You swear?
No, I mean --
What did you find? What did you see?
Could you tell me how to get there? The exact location?
Yes.
Yes.
Where are they taking him?
I am an English woman.
I will give you one hundred pounds to spare his life.
Two hundred pounds.
Three hundred pounds!
FIVE HUNDRED POUNDS!
NOOO!
He knows the location to Hamunaptra.
I would never!
Yes and if you cut him down, we will give you ten percent.
Twenty.
Twenty-five percent, and not one single farthing more.
Do you really think he'll show up?
Personally, I think he's filthy, rude and a complete scoundrel. I don't like him one bit.
Oh... um,... hello.
Mister O'Connell, can you look me in the eye, and guarantee me this is not some sort of flimflam? Because if it is, I'm warning you --
What are you doing here?
The only thing that scares me, Mister O'Connell, are your manners.
If you call that a kiss.
Did I miss something? Are we going into battle?
Yes, I'm hoping to find a certain artifact, a book, actually, my brother thinks there's treasure. What do you think is out there?
Ahmar is Ossirion. "Passageway to the underworld", actually.

I don't believe in fairy tales and hokum, Mister O'Connell, but I do believe that one of the most famous books in history is buried out there, The Book Of The Living. It's what first interested me in Egypt as a child. It's why I came here, sort of a life's pursuit.
You know your history.
By the way,... why did you kiss me?
The map! We need the map!
Oh that's comforting.
Well of course I can swim, if the occasion calls for it.
Well I think they're cute.
Are you sure?
For what?
After all, you rode us night and day to win that bet.
That "thing" gets me excited.
The things that get you excited.
According to Bembridge Scholars, inside the statue of Anubis was a secret compartment, perhaps containing The Book Of The Living.
Ancient Egyptian trick. You'll see.
Do you realize, we are standing inside a room that no one has entered in over four thousand years.
Cretins.
Oh my god, It's a preparation room.
For entering the afterlife.
Let's be nice, children, if we're going to play together, we must learn to share.
According to my calculations, we should be right under the statue. We'll come up right between his legs.
Oh my.
Yes, if their Egyptologist hasn't already found it.
You two are worse than a couple of schoolboys.
Oh my god,... it looks like, it looks like a sarcophagus.
They didn't, they buried him at the foot of Anubis. He was either someone of great importance. Or he did something very naughty.
'He that shall not be named.'  O'Connell dusts off the huge LOCK  O'CONNELL There's some sort of lock here. You say these thing's are made of granite with a steel interior?
Quarried granite with a cobalt lining.
A key! That's it! That's what he was talking about.
The man on the barge. The one with the hook, he was looking for a key.
What do you suppose killed him?
How?
You two!
No. I believe if I can see it and I can touch it, then it's real. That's what I believe.
Yes,... fine,... thank you.
Where's Jonathan?
Unlike my brother, sir, I know when to say no.
I know, you're wondering, what's a place like me doing in a girl like this?

Egypt is in my blood. My father was a famous explorer, he loved Egypt so much that he married an Egyptian. My mother! Who was quite an adventurer herself  O'CONNELL Okay, I get your father, I get your mother and I get your brother, but what are you doing here?
I may not be an explorer, or an adventurer, or a treasure hunter, or a gunfighter! Mister O'Connell But I'm proud of what I am.
...I am a librarian!
I'm going to kiss you, Mister O'Connell.
I'm not?
Why would I do that?
I can't believe I allowed the two of you to get me drunk.
Well neither do I, thank you.
No... Why?... Should I?
Oh my god, I've dreamed about this ever since I was a little girl.
Look, all the sacred spells have been chiseled off. The hieratics and hieroglyphs that protect the deceased on his journey into the afterlife, they've been removed. This man was cursed,... doomed.
No. I've never seen a mummy look like this. He's, he's still...
Yes. He's more than four thousand years old and still decomposing.
Oh my god, he was buried alive.
And he left a message.
It says: 'Death is only the beginning.'  Jonathan shivers. O'Connell looks around.
Scarabs, flesh eaters, I found them inside our friend's coffin. They can stay alive for years living off the flesh of a corpse, or in this case...
Famished.
Very slowly.

According to my readings, our friend suffered the HOM-DAI, the worst of all ancient Egyptian curses, one reserved for only the most evil blasphemers. In all of my research, I've never read of this curse actually having been performed.
Yes, they never used it because they feared it so. It's written, that if a victim of the HOM-DAI should ever arise, he would bring with him the ten plagues of Egypt.
That's one way of putting it.
Fried gizzard anyone?
It's just a book, no harm ever came from a book.
Ahm kum Ra. Ahm kum Dei.
This is not a plague. It's generational. Every so many years the locusts of Egypt have a population explosion and they all take flight.
Oh thank goodness, you're one of the Americans, aren't you?
Help me,... please,... help me.
Having an encounter with a four thousand year old walking-talking corpse tends to convert one.
No, we are not.
No we are not. We woke him up, and we must try and stop him.
Alright then, Me, I,... I read the book, I woke him up and I intend to stop him.
Then we'll have to find some immortal ones.
According to that Book, once this creature has been reborn, his curse will spread, and as he grows in strength, so will his curse grow, infecting the people until the whole of the earth is destroyed.
It's everybody's problem!
That's what I am to you? A contract?
I'm staying.
The creature!? Are you sure!?
There's only one person I know who can possibly give us some answers.
What is he doing here?
And you think this justifies killing innocent people!?
Anck-su-namun.
In the necropolis, when I saw him, -
We must stop him from regenerating.
Who opened that chest?
We must find the Egyptologist and bring him back here to the safety of the fort, before the creature can get to him.
Who put you in charge? You can't just leave me behind like some old suitcase. I'm the one responsible for this mess and I intend to be the one to clean it up.
You called me your girl?
I think you were jealous  O'CONNELL Jealous? You kiddin' me? Did you see that guy's face?
Last month I came across an inscription that mentioned The Book Of The Dead.
Yes. I dismissed it, because it talked about bringing people back from the dead. A notion I was unwilling to believe.
I'm thinking that if the black Book Of The Dead can bring people back to life --
Exactly --
Not quite yet it hasn't. C'mon.
Got it!
Since the black Book of The Dead was found inside the statue of Anubis, then according to this, the golden Book of The Living should be inside...
The golden Book Of The Living, is inside the statue of Horus.
He's gorgeous.
Any bright ideas?
I have no choice.
All eternity, idiot.
You better think of something, because if he turns me into a mummy, you're the first one I'm coming after.
Yes, I know, and I'd like to keep them.
NOOO!!
What just happened?
Stop it! You'll kill them!
You know, nasty little fellows such as yourself, always get their comeuppance.
Oh yes, always.
Tell him, I'm truly flattered... but that it's already taken.
Intestines.
You only want me for my organs?!
Shut-up and get me off of here!
Open the book, Jonathan! Open the book! That's the only way to kill him!
Read the inscription on the cover!
Finish the inscription, idiot!
What's it look like!?
Ah! Ah! Ahmenophus!
Kadeesh mal! Kadeesh mal! Pared oos! PARED OOS!!
Death is only the beginning.
Look at this! Sons of the Messiah! Give me frogs, flies, locusts, anything but this! Compared to you, the other plagues were a joy!
When Ramesses destroyed Syria, it was an accident. You are a catastrophe! Why do I put up with you?
Who needs smart women? I put up with you because your mother and father were our finest patrons, Allah rest their souls. Now straighten up this mess!
Perhaps.
My dear girl, don't be ridiculous, we are scholars, not treasure hunters. Hamunaptra is a myth.
As the Americans would say: it's all fairy tales and hokum.
It's for the best, I'm sure. Many men have wasted their lives in the foolish pursuit of Hamunaptra, no one has ever found it, most have never returned.
I'm sure it was a fake, anyway, I'm surprised at you, Miss Carnarvon, to be so fooled.
She must die.
No! She has seen too much. She knows too much.
Not only does she have a map, but she has the key.
Yes. No one has ever had so much, been so close. We must stop her, or it will be the end of us all.
And burn the map and retrieve the key.
Forget the bumbling Americans, they will be like all the others. Without the map to guide them, how can they possibly find Hamunaptra?
Miss Carnavon. Gentlemen.
Do you truly wish to know? Or would you prefer to just shoot us?
You will not believe it.

We are part of an ancient secret society, the cult-of-the-Mumia, and we have a sacred mission, passed down through thirty-nine generations. For over four thousand years we have guarded The City Of The Dead. we are sworn at manhood to do any and all in our power to stop the High Priest Imhotep from being reborn into this world.
To have stopped this creature? Yes!
According to the ancients, cat's are the guardians at the gates of the underworld. Imhotep will fear them until he is fully regenerated, and then he will fear nothing.
Yes, the creature must first try and regenerate, and then he will attempt to resurrect the one he has loved for more than four thousand years.
It is because it was you who read from the Book. He has chosen you to be the human sacrifice needed to regenerate the body of Anck-su-namun.
-- then perhaps, the golden Book Of The Living can return them to the underworld.
-- And read the sacred incantations contained inside it.
Correct, And that's when --
Which would be located not far to the east of the Anubis statue.
If we want to kill the creature, yes.
Go! Find a way! Kill the creature!
Drunkard? Fool? Rat-bastard? Please call me something original.
Right now, I only wish to join them.
My dear, sweet, baby sister, I'll have you know, that at this moment my career is on a high note.
Oh yes I do! I have something right here!
On a dig, down in Thebes.
My whole life I've never found anything, Evy. Tell me I've found something.
Yes?
Two questions. Who the hell is Seti the First? And was he rich?
Alright, good, that's good. I like this fellow, like him very much.
Are we talking about the Hamunaptra?

Right, right, in a big underground treasure chamber. Everybody knows the story. The entire necropolis was rigged to sink into the sand. On Pharaoh's command, a flick of the switch! And the whole place could disappear beneath the dunes.
You burned it! You burned off the part with the lost city!
You killed my map.
I was mistaken.
I lie to everybody, what makes you so special?
That just makes you more gullible.
Picked his pocket, actually.
Way to go, Evy.
She's my sister, actually.
How do we know that's not a load of pig swallow?
Um, well, you see...
Undoubtedly, I know the breed, he may be a cowboy, but his word is his word.
Smashing day for the start of an adventure, eh, O'Connell?
Yes, yes, you're right, filthy, rude, a complete scoundrel, nothing to like there at all.
Sit down, O'Connell, sit down, we could use another good player.
I say, what a coincidence, why --
-- whose deal is it? Is it my deal? I thought I just dealt?
EVY!!
Hey that's mine --
Americans.
I say! Good show!
And did I panic?
I think not.
I can't believe the price of these fleabags.
Yes, awfully tempting, wasn't it?
Never did like camels. Filthy buggers. They smell, they bite, they spit. Disgusting.
And you snore!
All night you snored!
What in bloody hell is this?
Ah, begging your pardon, but shouldn't we be going?
That thing gives me the creeps.
And it stinks to high heaven in here.
Mummies, my good son, this is where they made the mummies.
Yes, me too.
And when those dirty Yanks go to sleep --
No offense.
We'll sneak up and steal that book right out from under them.
I say, what's our smelly little friend got himself up to?
OWCH! That's really got to hurt.
Still...
Well?... Who is it?
Whoever's in here, sure wasn't getting out.
Hey that's mine!
Did you ever see him eat?
Maybe this place really is cursed.
Seagrams!
Well, he may have been a stinky fellow,... but he had good taste.
Evy! Excuse me! But didn't the man just say -- !
Let 'em have it, boys!
I say, bloody good show.
Don't blame me, I don't even remember being there.
Yes, I'm all tears, now let's see who's inside, shall we?
Juicy?
What are you going to do? Shoot him?
What is this stuff? It smells like our late friend, the Warden.
You did not!?... We're not!?
He certainly was not a popular fellow when they planted him.
Let's see, there was frogs, flies, locusts...
And my personal favorite: people covered in boils and sores.
Did you see that!? Grasshoppers! Billions of grasshoppers!
EVY!?
You're not going to kill us?
"And the rivers and waters of Egypt went red and were as blood."
Who's here!?
This is not good. Not good at all.
"...and he stretched forth his hands towards the heavens, and there was darkness throughout the land of Egypt."
Me?
That looked rather painful.
Ya know, ever since I met you, my luck has been for crap.
Yes, I know, I do that to people.
And then he'll be coming after Evy.
What?
Anck-su-namun! Anck-su-namun!
Hey that's mine -- !
I'm with you, old man. No one touches my sister like that and gets away with it.
And what ritual would that be?
And how does one do that?
Oh yes, of course.
Excuse me?
Begging your pardon, but I wasn't quite clear on that last part.
Did you say 'kill' my sister?
Everybody else we've bumped into has died, why not you?
Excuse me... A little help would be useful... IF IT'S NOT TOO MUCH TROUBLE!!
He's a big fellow with pointy ears and a face like a falcon.
I say, look at that.
Say, gents! You should come have a look at this.
There he is!
Hello Horus old boy.
I can't open it! It's locked or something!
We need the key!
What do I do, Evy!? What do I do!?
Keetash-something, naraba-something.
Ebarra im hatu Kashka ummmmm -- ?
Rasheem Aaaaa ANUBIS!
Oh boy.
You have got to be joking?
Oh.
Ummm, Hootash im... Hootash im now what is this last symbol here?
It's an Anck symbol, with two little squiggly lines above it, and a bird, a stork! on either side.
Yes,... I see.
Hootash im Ahmenophus!
I got it!
Well,... I guess we go home empty handed.
I did not know, so when I heard you were coming, I asked him that myself.
He said... he was just looking for a good time.
I'll be back in a moment.
I tremble with anticipation.
To be hanged.
Apparently, he had a very good time.
No women allowed.
I would pay one hundred pounds just to see him hang.
Proceed!
And what else?
His neck did not break! Good! Now we watch him strangle to death.
You lie.
Are you saying this filthy godless son of a pig knows where to find The City Of The Dead? Truly?
Fifty percent.
Forty.
A bright good morning to all.
I have come to protect my investment, thank you very much.
I do not snore!
I have never snored!
Other seekers of Hamunaptra.
Who cares? I don't see no treasure.
Any last requests, pig?
She is like all the others. She will die in the desert.
The key!? She has the lost key!?
Then we will kill her, we will kill her and all those with her.
It will be done. But what of the American expedition? They leave tomorrow as well.
Where is the map?
And the key? Where is the key?
Then I'll find it myself.
For all the money we're paying you, something better god-damned well be under that sand.
Never? What if I were to wager five hundred dollars says we get to Hamunaptra before you?
Well, what the hell we doin'?
SEE YA THERE, O'CONNELL!
Where'd all these camels come from?
This here is our statue,... friend.
See! That proves it! Old Seti's fortune's gotta be under this sand!
Curse my ass.
Assimilate their organs and fluids? Ya mean eat 'em?
Stupid superstitious bastard.
Yeah! It's supposed to be made outta pure gold!
Ya know if ya dry him out, you can sell him for firewood.
Water turning to blood.
You bastards!
Right! And ya know how he gets fully regenerated?! By killing everybody who opened that chest and sucking us dry! That's how!
Yeah, I'm not leavin, this fort for nothin'.
The hell with this. I'm goin, downstairs to get me a drink. You want somethin'?
Shut-up! JUST SHUT-UP! We gotta do somethin'! we gotta do somethin, NOW! Before it's too late!
That book we found at Hamunaptra?
WHAT!?
"Hamunaptra," Daniels, that's all ya gotta keep sayin, to yourself, "Hamunaptra."
We got us a man who's actually been there.
First one to the city, O'Connell! Five hundred! Cash bucks!
Ya scared the bejeezus out of us, O'Connell.
Yeah, sure...
We'll let him open it.
For them to protect it like this, you just know there's got to be treasure down there.
Yeah, who cares.
Yeah, yeah, okay, what's it --
Yeah, well, let's just make sure we don't bring anybody back from the dead then, huh?
Ah hell, let's open it anyways.
I wouldn't trade ya for a brass spittoon!
Say O'Connell, whadaya think these honey's'll fetch back home?
The sun turning black.
RUN, YOU SONS-A-BITCHES! RUUUUN!
What did you do to him!?
Sweet Jesus! That tasted just like,...
The curse. The curse.
Well, there was me and Daniels here and then poor Burns of course, oh yeah, and that Egyptologist fella.
The hell with that! I'm not goin' nowhere! We're safe here.
Yeah, get me a glass of bourbon, a shot of bourbon and a bourbon chaser.
You're sure Hamunaptra is out there?
What makes you so confident, sir?
We hear you gentlemen found yerselves a nice gooey mummy. Congratulations.
Hail and fire.
Daniels! Henderson!
Daniels?... is that you?
Henderson?
The drawer there, spectacles.
As you see, I won't be needing them.
Seti was no fool.
FENI!
There is a curse upon this chest.
In these hallowed grounds, that which was set forth in ancient times, is as strong today, as it was then.
"Death will come on swift wings to whomever opens this chest".
It says, there is one, the undead, who if brought back to life, is bound by sacred law to consummate this curse.
He will kill all who open this chest,... and assimilate their organs and fluids.
And in so doing he will regenerate. And no longer be the undead, but a plague upon this earth.
I have heard told of this book, but I never truly believed it existed. This, good gentlemen, is a most priceless treasure.
NO! NOOOO! YOU MUST NOT!
What have we done?
LEAVE THIS PLACE!... LEAVE THIS PLACE OR DIE!
I told you to leave or die, you refused, and now you may have killed us all. For you have unleashed the creature that we have feared for more than four thousand years.
No mortal weapons can kill this creature. He is not of this world.
We saved him! Saved him before the creature could finish his work. Now leave, all of you, quickly, before he finishes you all.
We must now hunt him down, and try and find a way to kill him, before he consumes the earth. Allah be with us.
Know this, the creature will be coming for you. He must consummate the curse. And until he does, he will never eat, he will never sleep, and he will never stop.
And because of you, we have failed.
Tonight is the full moon. The moon of Osiris. It will begin tonight.
And if he succeeds, the two of them together will bring about the apocalypse.
It has begun. The beginning of the end.
Be calm. There is still time. We can stop him yet.
Yes. To Hamunaptra. To perform the ritual.
The ritual to bring the body of Anck-
By reading the Book Of The Dead.
And then killing your sister.
Imhotep is now able to cross the desert with great haste.
If he arrives before us, it will be too late.
Priests. Imhotep's priests.
They are evil, cursed, they matter not.
My turn.
I'm out.
Allow me.
Keep digging!
Save the girl! Kill the creature!
I'm the last of the Royal Force still stationed here, you know? All the other laddies died in the air and were buried in the sand.
Ever since the end of the Great War, there hasn't been a single challenge worthy of a man like me.
I just wish I would've chucked it with the other laddies, gone down in a flame of glory, instead of sitting around here, rotting from boredom and booze!
So what's your little problem got to do with His Majesty's Royal Air Corp?
Is it dangerous?
By Jove, do you really think so?
So what's the challenge then?
Winston Havlock at your service, sir!
Hang on, men!
We're going down!
Here I come, laddies!
YOU!
